ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Recognizing that it is only one part of your identity, how do you define your sexual identity? Would you say that you are...
Notes: 1= Only lesbian/gay; 2= Mostly lesbian/gay; 3= Bisexual; 4= Mostly heterosexual/straight; 5= Only heterosexual/straight; 6= Asexual, or Ace; 7= The words I use are (SPECIFY_____)

ElementDescription: Did your contact with people close to you change during the pandemic (between April 1, 2020 and March 31, 2021)?
Notes: 0 =No, there was no change.; 1= Yes, mild changes. (e.g., continued visits with social distancing or phone calls or through video chat or social media).; 2= Yes, moderate changes (e.g., loss of contact with some friends and family, but not all).; 3= Yes, severe changes (e.g., loss of contact with all of my friends and family).

ElementDescription: Did your access to food change during the pandemic (between April 1, 2020 and March 31, 2021)?
Notes: 0= No, my access to food did not change.;  1= Yes, I had enough food, but difficulty getting to the store or finding items.; 2= Yes, I was occasionally without enough food.; 3= Yes, I was frequently without enough food.

Notes: 0= Not since April 1, 2020; 1= Less than once a month but at least once since April 1, 2020; 2= About once a month; 3= Two or three times a month; 4= Once or twice a week; 5= Three or four times a week; 6= Nearly every day; 7= Once a day; 8= More than once a day

ElementDescription: [ASK IF B1C=01,02,03,04,05,06,07,08] Thinking back between April 1, 2020 and March 31, 2021, about how many drinks would you have on a TYPICAL day when you drank?
Notes: (RANGE 1-70 [NUMBER BOX]); 97= Cannot remember; 99= [NO ANSWER]

ElementDescription: [ASK IF B6Q=97, 99] Between April 1, 2020 and March 31, 2021, on those days when you drank any alcoholic beverage, how many drinks did you TYPICALLY have? Would it TYPICALLY be:
Notes: 1= 12 or more drinks; 2= Between 8 and 11 drinks; 3= Between 5 and 7 drinks; 4= Four drinks; 5= Three drinks; 6= Two drinks; 7= One drink; 96= None

ElementDescription: [ASK IF BIC NOT=0] Between April 1, 2020 and March 31, 2021, what is the LARGEST NUMBER of drinks you had on any single day? Think of all kinds of alcoholic beverages COMBINED, that is, any combination of bottles or cans of beer, glasses of wine, or drinks containing liquor of any kind. In this question, 1 drink is equal to a 12-ounce bottle or can of beer, a 5-ounce glass of wine, or 1 shot of liquor (1.5 ounces). Was it:
Notes: 1= 24 or more drinks in a single day; 2= 12 to 23 drinks in a single day; 3= At least 8, but less than 12 drinks; 4= 5, 6, or 7 drinks; 5= 4 drinks; 6= 3 drinks; 7= 2 drinks; 8= 1 drinks

ElementDescription: [ASK IF B15=01,02,99] Between April 1, 2020 and March 2021, how often did you have 12 or more drinks of any kind of alcoholic beverage (in a single day)? That is, any combination of bottles or cans of beer, glasses of wine, or drinks containing liquor of any kind?
Notes: 1= Every day or nearly every day; 2= Three to four times a week; 3= Once or twice a week; 4= Once to three times a month; 5= Less than once a month; 8= Once since April 1, 2020; 9= Never since April 1, 2020

ElementDescription: [ASK IF B15=01,02,03,99] Between April 1, 2020 and March 2021, how often did you have at least eight, but less than 12 drinks of any kind of alcoholic beverage (in a single day)?
Notes: 1= Every day or nearly every day; 2= Three to four times a week; 3= Once or twice a week; 4= Once to three times a month; 5= Less than once a month; 8= Once since April 1, 2020; 9= Never since April 1, 2020

Notes: 1= Every day or nearly every day; 2= Three to four times a week; 3= Once or twice a week; 4= Once to three times a month; 5= Less than once a month; 8= Once since April 1, 2020; 9= Never since April 1, 2020
